Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [screaming, Phyllis and Dwight wrestling] Got you! Broken arm! Boom Boom Boom! Broken Nose! Boom Boom Boom Boom! Broken Nose! Boom! Ha, gonna flip you!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Once a year Dwight holds a seminar updating us on the newest developments in the world of karate... because as we all know, the one thing thousand year martial arts do all the time is change.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: How can I pose this to you in a relatable way? You are all members of the Yakuza and you happen to be visiting the Lackawanna trolley museum... and you are attacked by triads... how can you hold them off until your clan arrives? You cannot go wrong with a throat punch [screams, pretends to punch Meredith in the throat]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: OK, so there's no defense for that, good to know.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, there is a defense for that. Let me demonstrate. Someone attack me. Kevin, go!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: No way. Last time you pulled my pants down and then you tried to choke me with my shoelace.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: False. I did choke you with your shoelace. Now come at me!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: OK, with all due respect to everyone here, I think the most worthy opponent of you is you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That is correct. Unless there happened to be measles present.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So let's just say that Dwight has come at you with the throat punch. Now how would you, Dwight, defend against it?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Easy. Allow me to demonstrate. I am attacking myself with a throat punch. Here it comes. [gives himself a fake throat punch] Block. Grasp wrist as such. [grasps wrist]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: And what if he comes at you with the other hand, because he does have two.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Good point. Second, throat punch, absorb the blow. [gives himself another throat punch and proceeds to both attack and defend himself] Groin punch, hip block, elbow to the gut. Uh oh, up to the nose. No, you're not. Ow! Oh!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh my God, he's making you look like such a fool.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: He really is, but not for long. [steps on foot] Ow! Instep, oh, not again. [more screaming] You let go, you let go. Oh, you're right, I can't hold on.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You two are so evenly matched I don't know how one of you is going to get the upper hand.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: The important thing to remember Jim... we always have what is called the element of surprise. [hits himself in the groin and moans]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: But I would say my favorite art form is a tie between sculpting and stand up comedy.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I did stand up comedy once.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You did?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah, I killed.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That sounds like it was hilarious.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: It was hilarious.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What is the meaning of this email that everyone got?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You'll have to be more specific Dwight, I get like eight emails a day.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: This one, from David Wallace to all Dunder Mifflin.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Woo hoo, shout out!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hello everyone I am sure you have seen the item in the Journal. I just want to stress that it's all conjecture. If there's any concrete news you will know ASAP.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Erin, do we have the journal?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Your feelings journal? You told me to put it in the time capsule.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Did you?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Michael, he means the Wall Street Journal online.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, the Wall.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I found the article. [everyone walks over to his desk, he begins reading the article] "On a day marked by panicked corporate board meetings, one that is relatively not surprising is Dunder Mifflin's. It is rumored that they will recommend... " and the article cuts off.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's $1.99 to finish the article. I wonder what it was going to say? [no one makes a move to pay for the article]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Are you serious? [starts typing on the computer and Andy begins to lean in toward the computer]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I got it, I got it... Oh, Tuna beat me to it.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: "It is rumored that they will recommend declaring bankruptcy."

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no, that doesn't make any sense.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Oh lord, we're all gonna lose our jobs.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Not necessarily, bankruptcy could mean a lot of things. Maybe they're just restructuring to get out of debt.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, that sounds awful.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Or it could mean the end of Dunder Mifflin.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh God. Well, that's an interesting theory.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You know what? You can all have jobs at Schrute Farms as human scarecrows. It doesn't pay much and you can't unionize.

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace's Secretary
Quote.Text: I'm sorry, Michael, David's in a meeting.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ah, well maybe you should spy on him. [in Valley Girl voice] Oh my God, wouldn't that be hilarious! [laughs]

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace's Secretary
Quote.Text: Um, I'll just have him call you back.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: OK, OK. Good. I'll catch you on the flippity flip. Bye. [hangs up phone] He's busy, he'll call me back when he's free.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [retching sounds coming from the men's bathroom, Kevin walks to the door and goes in] Michael, are you OK? Did you throw up in there?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, I'm just poopin'. You know how I be.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: It smells like throw up in here.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Crazy world. Lotta smells.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: [in lunch room with several coworkers] Guys, what if this is our last day at work? What if we never see each other ever again? [Andy scoffs and looks over at Erin, Erin looks sad]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I like Erin. There, I said it. I was kinda hoping she would ask me out, but things have not panned out on that front, so... it is time for the Nard Dog to take matters into his own paws.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [Michael in his office playing music loudly, Jim walks in and turns the volume down, Michael trailing off on singing] We have to do something because people are losing it out there wondering what's going to happen.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: OK, we need some sort of distraction for everybody. Anything new on YouTube? Doesn't even need to be good. Oh God, I can't think, need more Mullins.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Listen, Wallace said these were just rumors, right? So we have no reason to think the company is anything but fine. So if we just go on with our work, you and me, they'll follow along.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Monkey see, monkey do.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Monkey pee all over you.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That rhymes, so what have we on the docket today?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We have a monthly staff meeting

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Alright, let's conference room it up! [everyone is now in the conference room] Here's the deal guys. There is no new information as of yet, so I suggest we all just keep working.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Sure I'm a little nervous, but doing our work will make us feel better. I only slack off when things are good.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Customers have to use the coupon code from the website. And as of now there is no differentiation between the letter O and the zero, but we are working on that. Stay tuned for that.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [Michael leaves] He needs me. Seat saved infinity. [leaves]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: OK, great.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [walks back in, on cell phone] What? Oh my God! [everyone starts asking questions] There has been a murder. There's been a murder in Savannah. [runs back to his office]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Games have the power to distract people from stressful situations. Battleship got me through my parents' divorce. Operation got me through my vasectomy, i.e., my operation. I don't think I would have been able to endure my breakup with Holly had it not been for Toss Across.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: [reading the game box cover] Belles, Bourbon and Bullets, a murder mystery dinner party game.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It is so much fun. Everybody plays a character, we go around the room, we try to figure out who did it...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, I am wondering if this is a, uh, terrible idea.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: This is my call Jim, big picture stuff, it's about murder.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I thought we agreed that we wouldn't do things like this.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Tube City, you owe me one.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Co-managing is a give and take. You have to pick your battles. One of the battles that I picked was to stop Michael from running plastic tubes all over the office and placing hamsters inside of them. He was going to call it Tube City. So, yes, I do owe him one.

Quote.Speaker: Voice on CD player
Quote.Text: August the 5th, 1955. It's a sad day down here in Savannah. Local magnate Bill Bourbon was killed last night and all y'all have congregated tonight for a meal to celebrate Bill as he passes on to his great reward. You're not just here to pay your respects, you have to figure out which of y'all is the no-count scoundrel who killed him.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: This is ridiculous. [gets up to leave, as does Angela]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: There will be food. You leave, you do not get food.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: What kind of food?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Sandwich platters.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I'm in. [sits back down]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Baby carrots. [Angela sits back down]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: OK, here are your character cards. Take one, pass it down. Here is your prop box, some of your characters will have props. Now, on your character card, it tells you who you are, and what your alibi is. Everything else is up to your imagination. So, if you talk slowly in real life, your character could, say, have been kicked in the head by a horse.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Whoa, I'll try it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: OK, use your imaginations.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Who'd you get?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Naughty Nellie Nutmeg, a vivacious young socialite with a penchant for scandal.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oooooo, saucy.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: How about you?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Nathaniel Nutmeg, the local bartender and Nellie's brother.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Michael, I don't like this game. It's scary.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's not scary.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I don't like my character.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Who are you?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Voodoo Mama Juju, the witch doctor of the Savannah swamps. I'm not comfortable with this. [holds up a head]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well how do you think I feel? I mean I have to play Caleb Crawdad, handsome playboy. Every night, a different woman. Being oogled. Having to hug and kiss and spoon, I make them feel beautiful.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [looks at Oscar who is using his phone, grabs it] Well, well, well. What is this contraption, I do declare?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: It's my blackberry Michael, I am trying to get updates on the company.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Who's Michael? I'm Caleb Crawdad, I do declare.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: You don't have to keep saying "I do declare". Any time you say something it means you are declaring.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That is the way Southern people talk.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: And what Designing Woman are you basing that on?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Delta Burke, I do declare. Now, shall we get to the mystery?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'll go. [stands up, begins speaking with a southern accent] My name is Deborah U. Tante. Deb for short.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: That's clever, Debutante.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Bill Bourbon was my uncle. I would have never hurt him any more than I'd hurt a June bug.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Nice accent. You sound like Forrest Gump.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I do not.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well, you do actually. You've got this kinda like Florida Panhandle thing going, whereas what you really want is more of a Savannah accent, which is more like molasses just sorta spillin' out of your mouth.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Oooo, now do the Swedish chef.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Uh, not familiar, what province is he from?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: He lives on Sesame Street, dumbass.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: You know, I think I'm supposed to say something to Pam, I mean, Deb, OK? [in character] I overheard you asking the butler where the pistol was kept.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Wait a minute, wait a minute. I'm the butler. You were listening in on that? You rich people. You think you can do whatever you want to the servant class!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no, no. Don't turn this into a political thing.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I will poison your food.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I reckon I got something to say to Miss Beatrix Bourbon, if'n she don't mind.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oooooo, doggie, we got a party now!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I do believe that the game is a big hit. People are really diving into their characters.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Y'all.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: [Creed pulls into the parking lot and goes into the office] Sorry I'm late, boss. What's going on?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [accent] Sir, there has been a murder, and you are a suspect.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: OK. Hang on just a second. Let me just settle in and I'll be right back.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Very good, very good. Now, no one was there in the wine cellar. [Creed gets in his car and drives away]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [in character] Hey there young lady.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Hello.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I would be remiss if I did not ask the pretty young lady out on a date for this weekend.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Sounds like a plan, Sugar.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Alright, a plan it is.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Voodoo Mama Juju, explain your dalliance with the Dark Arts.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: It's not my fault, I was exposed to Harry Potter.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I know you did it!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I know she didn't do it. It's never the person you most suspect. It's also never the person you least suspect, since anyone with half a brain would suspect them the most. Therefore I know the killer to be Phyllis, AKA Beatrix Bourbon, the person I most medium suspect.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [in character] Do you want to go out on a date with me? We can make out by the horses.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Well, you know ol' Nellie's always up for a romp in the hay.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: How about a threesome?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Yeah, my boudoir's always open.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Nice.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I'm a little worried I might have asked out Naughty Nellie and not Erin. Which would be a whole lot less appealing, because Naughty Nellie says yes to everyone. And she might be a murderer.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I just got an email from corporate, specifically for Accounting to stop all payments to our vendors.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: What does that mean?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Well, maybe nothing but it could mean a problem with liquidity-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [accent] Whoa. What's this strange Yankee accent coming out of your mouth, son? This here's Savannah.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: [tries to speak in a high-pitched southern accent] This plantation, we're running low on greenbacks. We're having problems paying the people who give us the seeds and the dirt. We can't pay... [in regular voice] - Michael, I can't - Basically it could mean a lot of things, but it is unprecedented, so it's cause for concern.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: OK, I'm going back to work.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No no no no no no no. [accent] I'm going to skip forward to a relevant clue. Here we go.

Quote.Speaker: Voice on CD player
Quote.Text: Well by now you've figured out that ol' Beatrix Bourbon was the killer.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Michael, I was doing so well.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [accent] Are you going to believe that? That is a mis- that's a misdirection. We still don't know who the murderer is. [everyone leaves] Nellie Nutmeg, come back in here. I can't do this myself. Voodoo Mama Juju... what am I gonna do?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: OK, so Corporate is still in their meeting.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: That could be a good sign.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Hey everyone, Kevin's going to give us his take on the situation. Let's listen up.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Alright guys, it's a work day and you guys work here, so let's go do some work.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Now, Jim telling us all to work? I think that is a very good sign.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Don't just say things.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [Michael walks in] Oh, hey, Michael. Listen, I brought up those sales targets. Do you want to-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [accent] I do believe you have me mistaken, my name is Caleb Crawdad. Y'all skedaddled way too soon. We need to reopen this case.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, you're not reopening the case. The case is closed.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No it ain't.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Frankly, I'm not surprised. A lot of the evidence seemed to be based on puns.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Just thinking about Weekend at Bernie's. It's funny, the guy's dead the whole time.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I haven't seen it.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Speaking of weekends, you excited about our date this weekend?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [accent] Of course, Nathaniel.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah, OK.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [accent] Where are you taking me?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [accent] Well, finest steakhouse in all Savannah.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [accent] Savannah? That's a far way from Scranton.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Did you mean a real date?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: No. [laughs] Did you?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Totally... not. [Erin gets up and walks away]

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I thought it was for real. So I was excited, but it was just, it was part of the game.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You're sure it was water, it couldn't have been acid?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I already declared you, it was too dark to tell.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Stop playing games with me, Crawdad.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: This is not a game, this is my life. You are out of order, sir.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Answer me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You are out of order.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You are out of order.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You are-

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I think Michael may have snapped.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Or maybe he's just stuck in character.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well, which is worse? Snapped or stuck?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Both. They're both worse.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: It's going to be alright. We're a good company, we'll figure this out. We're not going under.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Jim, what if we both lose our jobs? I'm trying to think of a way that this all ends up fine, and I can't think of one.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [comes into Jim's office using accent] Deb, what in the world - do you have the vapors?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Michael, not now.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Can't wait, we have to get you to our witch doctor right now. Come on. Come on.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I should just go. [accent] Where to now Caleb?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: To Mama Juju Boo Boo.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Michael, can I... OK, I'm just going to skip right past the what and go with why.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Because this is the recreation of a crime scene.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: [laying on the ground] I'm the dead body and these are my brain chunks.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey shut up. You're dead.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Michael, can I talk to you in your office?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No Michael here, my name is-

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Caleb!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Today of all days...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, you shut up. They need this game, Jim. Let us have this stupid little game, alright? [Jim nods]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [accent] Oh, you startled me. My stars, my heart nearly leapt out of my chest. What can I do you for?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Wallace is on the phone. He's returning your call.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Detective Wallace?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I don't think so. I think it's David Wallace from Dunder Mifflin.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Aw, shucks, tell him I'm not here.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: You're not gonna answer the phone?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, I only answer to Detective Wallace 'cause I got a warm body in the other room.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'll take it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey David.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Hey, sorry to be getting back to you guys so late. Things are still a bit unclear, we didn't officially decide anything yet.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, OK.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: But if I can be candid with you here Jim, it's not good. We fully expect to be out of money by the end of the year. Insolvent. So, well... You know what? I'm sorry, I have to run. But we will talk soon, OK?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Sure. Oh, you know, while I have you... today I was working on this pitch for a supermarket chain, and it would actually be a big account and I wanted to-

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: You know what? I can't really get my head around anything like that right now, but that's great. Keep after it, but I gotta run.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: OK.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Thanks Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: See ya.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [Jim comes out of the office] What's the news?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nothing yet.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Well, I guess that's not-

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well there is some bad news. [accent] There has been another murder.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: A murder, you say? I do declare.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Conference room everyone.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Do we have to play?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Super.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, this could be a juicy one.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Get in there!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I think today was a good day to have two managers. 'Cause if you're a family stuck on a lifeboat in the middle of the ocean, one parent might want to just keep rowing. But if the other parent wants to play a game, it's not because they're crazy. It's because they're doing it for the kids. And I get that now.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: There has been a lot of murder and a lot of intrigue. My little heart can barely take it no more. [regular voice] Today is the hardest I have worked in a long, long time.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [Andy, Michael, and Dwight are pointing imaginary guns at each other] I didn't do it!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: OK, everybody just calm down.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I am calm.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: On the count of three we're all going to put down our guns.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I have crossbows.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We'll put down our weaponry on the count of three, you ready?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: OK, I'm ready.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: One, two, three.. [all scream]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Andy revealed himself to be a double agent. At which point Dwight felt comfortable revealing that he also was double agent. And then Michael announced to everybody that - get this- he was a double agent. Oh, and it is 6:00.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [Michael, Dwight, Andy and now Pam are in the circle and training their 'weapons' on each other, Jim walks in] Really?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [accent] It wasn't me. I'm not goin' down for this!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, I want to go home.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Get the keys out of my purse, start the car. [Jim and Pam slowly back out of the office, Pam has her weapon trained on everyone and then they run out]
